meanings.definition: A fine white clay used in ceramics and refractories.
meanings.sent1: The potter used kaoline to make the delicate porcelain vase.
meanings.sent2: The factory imported kaoline to mix with other materials for making bricks.
meanings.sent3: Why did the clay go to the spa? To become kaoline and feel refined!
meanings.sent4: Her skin was as smooth as kaoline after using the expensive face mask.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands were covered in kaoline as he molded the sculpture.

meanings.definition: A white or grayish-white clay mineral consisting mainly of kaolinite.
meanings.sent1: The geologist identified the kaoline mineral in the rock sample.
meanings.sent2: The mine was rich in kaoline, attracting many mineral collectors.
meanings.sent3: Why did the rock collection invite the kaoline mineral? To lighten up the party!
meanings.sent4: The moonlit landscape looked like a field of shimmering kaoline under the stars.
meanings.sent5: The riverbank was adorned with deposits of kaoline, creating a beautiful sight.
